Episodes.Title: Boxed In
Episodes.Plot: A rodent arrives in a box and sets off a battle of wits between an old man and a mouse.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Lip Synch - Creature Comforts Short
Episodes.Plot: As part of the Lip Synch series, Aardman produced this 5 minute film which became the inspiration for the hit TV series Creature Comforts.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Adam
Episodes.Plot: A six minute romp through the bits of the creation myth that the book of genesis dared not print. Directed by Aardman Co-Founder Peter Lord
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Stage Fright
Episodes.Plot: A former dog-juggling star of the music hall, rendered obsolete by the advent of cinema, has to face up to change. Told in flashbacks
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Al Dente
Episodes.Plot: Al, a waiter, is surprised by an order for a meal from an unconventional diner.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Animated Conversations - Confessions of A Foyer Girl
Episodes.Plot: A witty interpretation of the hidden dramas that underlie a seemingly mundane conversation between two real life cinema usherettes, one of who is tired to the point of hallucination.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Animated Conversations - Down and Out
Episodes.Plot: When a reasonably routine real-life conversation in a hostel for the homeless is brought to life in plasticine animation, the pathos of confused old age is brought tellingly home.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Babylon
Episodes.Plot: A dark & powerful film which takes an arms dealer's conference as the backdrop against which to explore the startling and macabre world-view of people who trade in annihilation.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: The Deadline
Episodes.Plot: Three animators struggle to make a film as the deadline looms. These three distinctive characters, Stefen, Brian and Dan were named after the original animators
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Conversation Pieces - Sales Pitch
Episodes.Plot: The desperation and hopelessness of a door-to-door salesman's life are brilliantly revealed in this animation of a conversation between a salesman and a couple who clearly have no intention of buying anything but seem happy to chat.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Conversation Pieces - On Probation
Episodes.Plot: A group of young offenders and carers try to negotiate a relatively simple dilemma,  but the more they talk, the further away from a solution they seem to get.

Episodes.Title: Conversation Pieces - Palmy Days
Episodes.Plot: By cleverly changing the location of a real-life conversation between five old people in a  retirement home, this film gets under the skin of a regular chat to reveal the participants' attitudes to each other and to their incarceration.

Episodes.Title: Conversation Pieces - Early Bird
Episodes.Plot: If you ever wondered what a smooth-talking local radio station host gets up to while broadcasting of a morning, then this film makes some very imaginative suggestions.

Episodes.Title: Conversation Pieces - Late Edition
Episodes.Plot: In the newsroom of a local newspaper, journalists and editors vie for space and attention in their next publication. The animation reveals the camaraderie and rivalry that go hand-in-hand with the drama of going to press.

Episodes.Title: Humdrum
Episodes.Plot: Two bored shadow puppets play themselves at their own game.

Episodes.Title: Len's Lens
Episodes.Plot: Amateur astronomer Len is over the moon when he discovers a new comet. But a disdainful colleague is not so sure this heavenly body is all it appears to be..

Episodes.Title: Lip Synch Series - Going Equipped
Episodes.Plot: A young man, who has spent almost half of his life in a variety of penal institutions, reflects on his life inside and outside prison.

Episodes.Title: Lip Synch Series - Ident
Episodes.Plot: Ident is a film of masks & weird goings on. A city of mirrors and mazes, putty people, plasticine places and bizarre changes. Includes the character that later went on to become Rex the Runt

Episodes.Title: Lip Synch Series - Next
Episodes.Plot: An empty stage, one actor, and the complete works of William Shakespeare. This is an audition quite unlike any other, with a great deal at stake.

Episodes.Title: Lip Synch Series - War Story
Episodes.Plot: A stirring story from the Second World War in which the narrator, Bill, speaks frankly about bombing and plumbing.

Episodes.Title: Live Earth - don't let it all unravel
Episodes.Plot: A simple and striking animated film depicting the word as knitting which slowly unravels to nothing.

Episodes.Title: Live Earth - anyone can make a difference
Episodes.Plot: Thomas Midgley Jnr is best known today as the inventor of CFC's and leaded petrol additives, but is it really fair to criticise him for inventions that made life easier for us at the time?

Episodes.Title: Off Beat
Episodes.Plot: In a simple world where watching TV and eating biscuits is paramount, a news report about a police holiday causes a stir.

Episodes.Title: Chunga Chui
Episodes.Plot: An African herdsman performs a tribal dance to ward off the evil spirit of the predatory Leopard.

Episodes.Title: Comfy
Episodes.Plot: One man will go to great lengths to get a good night's sleep.

Episodes.Title: Ernest
Episodes.Plot: An irreverent and frenetic account of one man's life from beginning to bitter end.

Episodes.Title: Hot Shot
Episodes.Plot: On location in the wild west, an ageing cowboy's last shot at being a star.

Episodes.Title: Out of Joint
Episodes.Plot: In a nose-centric world one man battles with his nasal deficiency. Observing his plight and his many nose-based fantasies, his girlfriend attempts to remedy the situation..

Episodes.Title: Owzat
Episodes.Plot: One summer night, a churchyard is the venue for a cricketing confrontation between spectral fielders and a skeletal batsman.

Episodes.Title: Pib and Pog
Episodes.Plot: Pib and Pog bring a whole new meaning to mischief as their harmless pranks become more outrageous.

Episodes.Title: Pearce Sisters
Episodes.Plot: An amusingly bleak hearted tale of two weather-lashed old spinsters. Lol and Edna Pearce live on a remote and austere strip of coast.

Episodes.Title: Pop
Episodes.Plot: A bored youth, a bored fish, a can of pop - the results are explosive!

Episodes.Title: Ramble On
Episodes.Plot: A mild-mannered ramble journeys through the hills of North Wales. Along the way he immerses himself in the wonder of nature.

Episodes.Title: Vacation
Episodes.Plot: It's holiday time, but a surprise is in store for this travel agent. Quirky, fun animation

Episodes.Title: Wat's Pig
Episodes.Plot: Two Brothers are separated at birth. One goes on to live in a castle in the hill as a powerful and wealthy Earl. Meanwhile his brother Wat, who has been raised since childhood by a friendly pig, scrapes a living in his humble hovel.
